result.execSummary:
The defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); all applicable fees of supervision. If revoked, Court ordered that all costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a conditions of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 30 MONTHS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial and motion hearing, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 11/16/2015 is vacated.    Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED, as to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and but withholds entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the Defense motion to adjourn final pre-trail and jury trial.  Jury trial date of 09/16/2015 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to adjourn trial from the defense received and filed.  Court will address at final pre-trial.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
One of the defense essential witnesses did not appear and defense counsel is not seeking a body attachment, but rather an adjournment. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL/DAUBERT HEARING on 8/20/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 9/16/2015 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendar for Jury Trial on 7/8/2015.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is in trial. Case rescheduled for FINAL PRETRIAL on 7/2/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Defenant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. sab

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Case is adjourned for hearing, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 15.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Tom Hayes in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Telephone call received from Attorney Tom Hayes.  He received a call from his client that he would be unable to get off of work to appear for the 8:30 a.m. scheduling conference.  Attorney Hayes will appear at 8:30 a.m. and his client will appear at 1:30 p.m. to obtain the new court date.  cg

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  David Belm on behalf of Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
 Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jhean Carlo Garcia Alcudia in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA as to COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Tom Hayes called and informed the court that the DA's office changed the court date from 3-13-2015 to 3-27-2015, at 1:30 pm. CCCR.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
